contentList.content: Your <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="RAGE">Rage</LSTag> no longer prevents you from casting spells.
You can't cast or concentrate on spells while raging.

You regain one use of your <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="Rage">Rage</LSTag> after a <LSTag Tooltip="ShortRest">Short Rest</LSTag> and all uses after a <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>.
You now regain all your uses of <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="Rage">Rage</LSTag> after a <LSTag Tooltip="ShortRest">Short Rest</LSTag>.
While holding nothing in your main and off hands, your unarmed attacks deal [1].
You deal additional damage equal to your Constitution <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityModifier">Modifier</LSTag> with unarmed strikes.
As a bonus action, make a melee unarmed attack against a creature, knocking it <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PRONE">Prone</LSTag>.

Your <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="RAGE">Rage</LSTag> turns into a frenzy! You gain <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_FrenziedStrike">Frenzied Strike</LSTag>, <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Throw_FrenziedThrow">Enraged Throw</LSTag>, and <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_FrenziedStrike_Unarmed">Enraged Strike</LSTag>. You can also make an <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Throw_ImprovisedWeaponBerserker">Improvised Weapon Attack</LSTag> as a bonus action.

While raging, your melee attacks deal an additional [1].

You gain Resistance to physical damage, and Advantage on Strength Checks and Saving Throws.

You can use Frenzied Strike.
